description: This game is awesome. It's fun to play, it's relaxing, and makes you engage in the game. Mindustry is also cross-platform, and you can manually transfer saves from one platform to another.
Not very good really,
i love this game
It looks nice, it plays nice, it has all kinds of unique mechanics, and it's free! I couldn't think of a better free startegy game!
I even have it on my phone and that's awesome!

This is a long, first impressions style review, so if that isn't what you're looking for skip this one:

With the items unlocked at the start of the game (speaking from the experience given from have beaten the first level after something like eight tries and starting on the second) the enemies are WAY too powerful, and it causes incredible balance issues and frequent frustration.

Not to mention that for a game about conveyer belts and automation, the game is extremely focused towards brute force style play that highly disincentivises actually managing your automation and trying to find ways to further optimize your design (besides trial and error, as some of what you built stays from one attempt to another, which I don't like for it's own reasons but fine); this is further reenforced by how the enemies will SHATTER your buildings if they get into contact with them.

The only strategy I found that made ANY headway is to build as much copper drills as possible around my base... thing, (because if I don't do that I won't have enough copper to build literally anything worthwhile in time) and then rush forward with the pathetic starter turrets as far forward as possible, down the one and only path that the enemies will go down no matter what (which I had to learn from trial and error), and then COVER it with the copper walls (you have to research those, and I think they're the only early builting you can research that is worth even considering), because while the enemies can't shoot over them, the turrets can (that isn't made clear anywhere; once again, trial and error).

It also helps to build copper walls around the sides coming up to the turrets, because the enemies will fire at the first thing they see and keep firing until it's destroyed or out of range it seems.

All of this flies out the window for the stronger enemies and flying enemies however, as the turrets and your drones fire basically only tickle the former, and literally none of your defences effect the latter, it will ignore them.

So overall, an unpleasant, unbalanced, unpolished experience.
It looks sleek, sure, but it feels like an early Alpha build, probably balanced in mind for those who were already playing during the prototype, and have at least have of the tech tree unlocked.

xo
summary: Utter Slog with Major Early Balance Issues

description: Steamdeck touch pads work great for this.

Didn't launch on linux (wayland, x11 is literally dead).

It's a good game, I've played it on android, but it didnt launch for me under a wayland session on arm64.
...in seiner Kategorie auf jeden Fall!
Jedoch Empfehle ich die itch.io Version zum spielen von Multiplayer matches , da es sich dort immer um die aktuellste Version handelt,was bei dieser nicht der Fall ist.
Dieses Spiel ist mit einer der besten Open-Source Spiele die es gibt!
The Flatpak-Version of this game is great. It is fast and stable. I had to remove 1 star, because Foo's Client is not working correctly.

El concepto básico es simple, debes defender tu núcleo de oleadas de enemigos de distintos niveles de fuerza, hasta ahí nada nuevo bajo el alero del género de tower defense, lo interesante entra cuando en paralelo para poder suministrar una fuente materiales, tanto para la construcción como para que las torretas puedan atacar (munición) o potenciar su fuerza, hay que preparar una red logística, en la que habrá que buscar desde cobre, plomo, tungsteno, berilio, arena; refinar silicio, grafito, petroleo; para poder surtir la base principal, las torretas y fabricas. 

El juego puede ser un poco complicado, pero el continuo desarrollo ha logrado mantener equilibrada la experiencia, tanto para novatos como para veteranos. Para poder mantener la complejidad limitada se van incorporando nuevos conceptos poco a poco, por lo que en cada nivel se van presentando desafíos y nuevas formas de resolver problemas (por ejemplo, la distribución de munición entre varias torretas)

Además posee un modo multijugador, en el que puedes colaborar para defender de la computadora o puedes enfrentarte con otros jugadores en batallas desmedias y eternas, la posibilidad de volver a empezar es muy extensa.

Lo único que a veces podría resultar en un problema es que se puede sobrepasar fácilmente ciertos niveles (modo campaña) y una vez avanzado puedes olvidar conceptos con facilidad (taladros/fabricas/conductos/etc)

El juego está también en github, Itch.io, Steam, Android y iOS, por lo que puedes llevar tu experiencia a todos lados.

Recomendado!

Es un muy buen tower defense y bien diseñado en graficos y jugabilidad, esta en casi todas las plataformas, en itch.io en steam y google play para los que quieren jugarlo en todas partes, Muy recomendado
